intro: Oxalis corniculata var. ciliifera, commonly known as the hairy wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Asia and parts of Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with hairy margins, which give it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow with five petals, and it produces small, round berries that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
